name: Lauren Conrad
religion: She seems to be non-religious in a Christian sort of way.
politicalViews: She encourages people to vote, doesn't want people to know her views, and is probably Republican.
author: Caitlin Frye

content.text: Lauren Conrad was born and raised in Laguna Beach, California.
She appears e does the Christmas thing but more in an I-want-cool-stuff way rather than a let's-celebrate-our-Lord kind of way.
Several websites speculate that she is not very devout
and one source says she doesn't talk about her faith because she doesn't want to offend those that do not share it.
But then again, she was spotted coming out of a psychic's office,
so maybe there's a side to her spirituality that no one knows about.

content.sourceTitle: Seventeen Texting Voting PSA With Lauren Conrad.
content.text: Conrad is all about getting out the vote,
but that doesn't mean she wants you to know who she's voting for. She's more concerned about how other people will view her than she is about influencing the political process.

content.sourceTitle: Lauren Conrad Needs A New Home.
content.text: I believe in a private ballot. I don't want to ever influence someone's vote or have my vote change someone's opinion of me.

content.sourceTitle: Lauren Conrad Is a Republican, Just Like Heidi.
content.text: But apparently some reporters caught her vigorously applauding the mention of Republicans and smirking at that of Democrats at the White House Correspondence dinner in 2008.
So if we're to believe the gossip, I guess we'll call her a Republican.

content.sourceTitle: Statement Jewelry: Support Charity Through Fashion.
content.text: She's all about the politically safe philanthropy, though. She supports causes like fighting childhood cancer,

content.sourceTitle: Lauren Conrad's Charity Work, Events and Causes.
content.text: supporting victims of domestic violence, and alleviating domestic hunger.

Conrad also showed her support for a typically liberal cause. She worked with the environmentally conscious company Blue Avocado to create a collection of bags and travel products made from recycled plastic bottles. The young designer wants to bring social responsibility and fashion together:
The collection represents easy steps we can all take where doing good and looking good are aligned.
It seems  now to be environmentally conscious, so maybe it's less about supporting the tree-hugging lefties, and more about staying in the uncontroversial mainstream, and making sure people like her.
